recommendations.title: SMART Goal Setting for Financial Milestones
recommendations.description: Apply the SMART framework (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) to savings goals. Includes templates for emergency funds, down payments, and retirement.
recommendations.rationale: You've grown your savings by 4.4% recently, showing strong momentum. SMART goals help channel that discipline toward specific milestones.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: High-Yield Savings Accounts: Where to Find the Best Rates
recommendations.description: Comparison of online banks offering 4-5% APY vs. traditional banks at 0.01%. Covers FDIC insurance, account minimums, and transfer times.
recommendations.rationale: With $1,747 saved in the last 6 months, moving to a high-yield account could earn you an extra $50-150/year in interest.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: Automating Your Savings: Set It and Forget It
recommendations.description: How to automate transfers from checking to savings on payday. Includes tips for starting small and gradually increasing amounts.
recommendations.rationale: Your savings inflow of $1,747 over 6 months shows you're already saving consistently. Automation makes it effortless.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: Certificates of Deposit (CDs): Locking In Higher Rates
recommendations.description: When CDs make sense for part of your savings. Covers laddering strategies, penalty-free CDs, and how to balance liquidity with returns.
recommendations.rationale: With 7.3 months of emergency savings, you may have excess funds that could earn higher rates in CDs.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: The 50/30/20 Rule: Balancing Needs, Wants, and Savings
recommendations.description: Popular budgeting framework: 50% needs, 30% wants, 20% savings/debt. Includes how to adapt percentages to your situation and track progress.
recommendations.rationale: You're already saving $1,747 per month. The 50/30/20 rule can help you optimize other spending categories too.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: Ally Bank High-Yield Savings Account
recommendations.description: Top-rated online bank with competitive APY (4.0%+), no fees, no minimums, and excellent customer service. FDIC insured.
recommendations.rationale: You've saved $1,747 in the last 6 months. Moving to Ally's high-yield account could earn you an extra $100-300/year in interest.
recommendations.disclaimer: This is educational content, not financial advice. Consult a licensed advisor for personalized guidance.

recommendations.title: Fidelity Go Robo-Advisor
recommendations.description: Automated investment service with low fees (0.35%). Good for long-term savings goals beyond emergency funds.
recommendations.rationale: With 7.3 months in emergency savings and continued growth of 4.4%, you may be ready to invest excess savings for long-term goals.
